alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 18 at 6:37AM EST until December 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. SEWELLS POINT VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/12 PM 3.0 0.2 0.7 3 NONE 19/02 AM 1.9 -0.9 -0.5 2 NONE 19/02 PM 1.9 -0.9 -0.5 3 NONE 20/03 AM 2.2 -0.6 -0.3 2 NONE 20/03 PM 2.2 -0.6 -0.1 2 NONE CHESAPEAKE BAY BRIDGE TUNNEL VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.0 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.1 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/11 AM 3.2 0.3 0.8 5 NONE 19/01 AM 2.2 -0.7 -0.3 4 NONE 19/02 PM 2.1 -0.8 -0.4 4 NONE 20/02 AM 2.4 -0.5 -0.2 4 NONE 20/02 PM 2.4 -0.5 0.0 3 NONE LYNNHAVEN INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 18/12 PM 3.0 0.3 0.8 1 NONE 19/02 AM 1.9 -0.8 -0.2 1 NONE 19/02 PM 1.9 -0.8 -0.3 1 NONE 20/03 AM 2.1 -0.6 -0.1 1 NONE 20/03 PM 2.1 -0.6 0.1 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
